  • Methodendetails

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      In this Methode, it is checked if the user has unlocked the levels. If not the level-Image gets disabled, so he cant start the level.
      Angegeben von:
      initialize in Schnittstelle javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameter:
      url -
      resourceBundle -

    • onLevelStartButtonClicked

      public void onLevelStartButtonClicked()
      In this Methode, the story-dialogs fxml gets loaded in the current stage

    • onLevelSelected

      public void onLevelSelected(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent) throws IOException
      In this Methode, the user interaction with the level-Images gets checked. When pressed on an Image the user gets displayed information about the Level. For Example, the name, a short description, the difficulty, and the best time of the user.
      Parameter:
      mouseEvent -
      Löst aus:
      IOException

    • onReturnButtonClicked

      public void onReturnButtonClicked()
      In this Methode, the scene gets changed back to the start-menu.

    • disableLevelIcon

      public void disableLevelIcon(javafx.scene.image.ImageView icon)
      In this Methode, the level Icon gets visually disabled and cannot be clicked. The saturation of the icon is reduced and the opacity is set to 0.75.
      Parameter:
      icon - the icon of the Level

    • applyLayoutBindings

      public void applyLayoutBindings()
      In this Method, the fxml layouts fot the different elements gets changed to make it a bit responsive.

    • getSelectedLevel

      public int getSelectedLevel()

    • setSelectedLevel

      public void setSelectedLevel(int selectedLevel)
